+// Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+// or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file

+#ifndef GANDIVA_RANDOM_GEN_HOLDER_H
+#define GANDIVA_RANDOM_GEN_HOLDER_H
+
+#include <memory>
+#include <random>
+
+#include "arrow/status.h"
+
+#include "gandiva/function_holder.h"
+#include "gandiva/node.h"
+#include "gandiva/visibility.h"
+
+namespace gandiva {
+
+/// Function Holder for 'random'
+class GANDIVA_EXPORT RandomGeneratorHolder : public FunctionHolder {
+ public:
+  ~RandomGeneratorHolder() override = default;
+
+  static Status Make(const FunctionNode& node,
+                     std::shared_ptr<RandomGeneratorHolder>* holder);
+
+  double operator()() { return distribution(generator_); }
+
+ private:
+  explicit RandomGeneratorHolder(int seed) {
+    int64_t seed64 = static_cast<int64_t>(seed);
+    seed64 = (seed64 ^ 0x00000005DEECE66D) & 0x0000ffffffffffff;
+    generator_.seed(static_cast<uint64_t>(seed64));
+  }
+
+  RandomGeneratorHolder() {
+    std::random_device rd;
+    generator_.seed(rd());
+  }
+
+  std::mt19937_64 generator_;
 
 Review comment:
   have we tested the perf for this? looks like this is the slowest of the three random generators
   https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random
   
   do we need anything better than the fibonacci one..

+#define GANDIVA_RANDOM_GEN_HOLDER_H
+
+#include <memory>
+#include <random>
+
+#include "arrow/status.h"
+
+#include "gandiva/function_holder.h"
+#include "gandiva/node.h"
+#include "gandiva/visibility.h"
+
+namespace gandiva {
+
+/// Function Holder for 'random'
+class GANDIVA_EXPORT RandomGeneratorHolder : public FunctionHolder {
+ public:
+  ~RandomGeneratorHolder() override = default;
+
+  static Status Make(const FunctionNode& node,
+                     std::shared_ptr<RandomGeneratorHolder>* holder);
+
+  double operator()() { return distribution(generator_); }
+
+ private:
+  explicit RandomGeneratorHolder(int seed) {
+    int64_t seed64 = static_cast<int64_t>(seed);
+    seed64 = (seed64 ^ 0x00000005DEECE66D) & 0x0000ffffffffffff;
+    generator_.seed(static_cast<uint64_t>(seed64));
+  }
+
+  RandomGeneratorHolder() {
+    std::random_device rd;
+    generator_.seed(rd());
+  }
+
+  std::mt19937_64 generator_;
+  std::uniform_real_distribution<> distribution;
 
 Review comment:
   done. Thanks

fields.description: Implement random(), random(int seed) functions. The values are sampled from a uniform distribution(0, 1) The random values for each row of a column are generated from same generator which is initialised at (function) build time.
